roleset.name: to make a choice, to pick out

example.name: transitive
example.text: Such laws violate the provision in Article II that requires the president to make recommendations to Congress , but which gives [the president]-1 the discretion [0]-2 [*]-1 to select the subject matter of those recommendations [*T*-2] .
example.arg: the subject matter of those recommendations

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Buyers with $ 6 million to spend can select from 11 designs , including a Mediterranean-inspired California style , a traditional Yankee look and designs inspired by Midwestern architect Frank Lloyd Wright .
example.arg: from 11 designs , including a Mediterranean-inspired California style , a traditional Yankee look and designs inspired [*] by Midwestern architect Frank Lloyd Wright

example.name: with Arg3
example.text: Torchmark also said that [Samuel E. Upchurch Jr. , 37 , vice president and general counsel]-2 , was selected [*-2] to serve the remainder of the term vacated by John S.P. Samford , who resigned as director .
example.arg: to serve the remainder of the term vacated by John S.P. Samford , who resigned as director

example.name: prepositional Arg3
example.text: Sterling , which estimated the value of the contract at $ 150 million , said NASA selected another bidder for final negotiations .

roleset.note: Member of Vncls obtain-13.5.2, characterize-29.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'select' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
